othello.model

Class Move

  • java.lang.Object
    • othello.model.Move

  • public class Move
extends java.lang.Object

      The origin move is used to store origins.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Move(int x, int y)
      This constructor is used to generate a single move.
      Move(int x, int y, Move origin)

    • Method Summary

      Methods

      getOrigin will return a Move object.

      void setMove(int x, int y)
      Thia
      void setMove(int x, int y, Move origin)
      This method allows setting of the Move, so that the move can be changed, for example, when using Moves to control logic of a game or determine if moves adhere to rules.

    • Field Detail

      • origin

        private Move origin
        The origin move is used to store origins. By having an internal Move object, we can represent a recursive data structure.

      • x

        private int x

      • y

        private int y

    • Constructor Detail

      • Move

        public Move(int x,
    int y,
    Move origin)
        This constructor allows the user to generate a move that involves many moves. This can be useful in the situation where you need to move an object from one location to another, or alternatively, need to move an object many locations.
        Parameters:
        x - The X-Axis location of the move
        y - The Y-Axis location of the move
        origin - The previous move.

      • Move

        public Move(int x,
    int y)
        This constructor is used to generate a single move. A single move is useful in situations where the user would only want to action on a piece, rather than re-locate or do some comparisons.
        Parameters:
        x - The X-Axis location of the move
        y - The Y-Axis location of the move

    • Method Detail

      • setMove

        public void setMove(int x,
           int y,
           Move origin)
        This method allows setting of the Move, so that the move can be changed, for example, when using Moves to control logic of a game or determine if moves adhere to rules.
        Parameters:
        x - The X-axis of the move
        y - the Y-Axis of the move
        origin - The origin of the move.

      • setMove

        public void setMove(int x,
           int y)
        Thia
        Parameters:
        x - The X-axis of the move
        y - the Y-Axis of the move

      • getX

        public int getX()

      • getY

        public int getY()

      • getOrigin

        public Move getOrigin()
        getOrigin will return a Move object. The origin could contain many more moves. This is a move that should represent a move's parent or base.
        Returns:
        The origin move.
